ing: 1 (28 ounce) can diced tomatoes with juice
3 cups cooked white rice (such as Uncle Ben'sÂ®)
des: "This is awesome as a side dish with enchiladas, tortillas, or any other Mexican dish."
ins: Heat butter in a frying pan over medium heat; cook and stir onion, green bell pepper, celery, and garlic until slightly tender, 5 to 10 minutes. Stir tomatoes with juice, chili powder, beef bouillon granules, and salt into onion mixture; add rice. Simmer rice mixture, stirring occasionally, until heated through and flavors are blended, 15 to 20 minutes.
